questionTitle: After the party the children was allowed to finish off the ________ sandwiches and cakes.
We would very much ________ a reply by the end of the month.
When he heard the joke, he burst into loud ________.
I don't think I could ever get used to ________ to work so early.
________ amount of money can buy true friendship.
The Government should be spending money on new hospitals ________ than on defence.
I was very ________ of myself for forgetting Mother's birthday.
She's got a fabulous job and she earns a great ________ of money.
Mrs Carter is an expert ________ the mating habits of the ostrich.
It's difficult to tell the twins apart because the look exactly the ________.
Contrary to my expectations, there was no need to be uneasy ________ the results of the match.
It is impossible to prevent them ________ quarrelling with each other.
This car is inferior ________ the one I bought last year.
He plays ________ the school team.
I despair ________ ever teaching him anything.
We are fortunate in having sufficient supplies of fuel ________ the winter.
He was found guilty ________ a great many crimes.
________ Patrick, he can't possibly go alone - he's far too young.
I'm afraid I know nothing about the fight for independence. It was ________.
Many of the jobs which have been created in this area can be directly ________ to tourism.
